intro: Kennedia eximia, commonly known as the wattle tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow or orange flowers that resemble small lanterns. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. Kennedia eximia thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions and dry forests.
